column1: Senior Design Engineer - Electrical Engineering Services
column2: Bachelor degree or equivalent in Electrical Engineering. Diploma candidates preferably with good experience will be considered.Key Skills:Uses CAD system to enter the required data, such as precise measurements and commands, in order to generate construction drawings, renderings, report graphics and other digital images. Prepares complex layouts, drawings and designs from written or verbal specifications or from rough or detailed sketches and / or drawings made by technicians, designers or technical professionals, converting paper documents into computerized file. Produces various design options on the screen or in hard copy, following a designer or technical professional verbal instructions or ideas to assist in resolving a design concept not yet completely defined.Job DescriptionThe incumbent will specifically be responsible for:  -  -  Assist the Team Leader in performing of their duties.  -  -  Produce Hand sketch drawings  -  -  Set the design benchmarks, check design calculation & drawings.  -  -  Check documentation complies with Design Criteria / Client Brief / Approved Concept  /  Standards.  -  -  Attend design, clients, architects and site meetings.  -  -  Resolve any technical problems faced during the project design and / or construction stages.  -  -  Senior engineers must be able to lead projects and supervise a team of engineers / technicians under their charge.Job Responsibility:Gemini has been providing infrastructure planning, engineering, construction, to public and private clients across India for more than 10 years We have the depth and breath of expertise to respond to the most technically challenging and time - critical projects At Gemini, we offer our employees more than just a job; we offer an opportunity to shape the world for generations to come through innovative and sound design. Gemini seeks a highly motivated, self - starter to join our Bangalore, Chennai and Mumbai, as an Electrical CAD Designer. In this role you will provide proficiency in computer - assisted drafting & design to support the technical services.Desired Profile:The desired candidate must have extensive design knowledge and experience for building projects in an engineering consultancy firm. An ideal candidate should possess the following qualifications:  -  -  Recognised Bachelor degree or equivalent in Electrical Engineering; Diploma candidates preferably with good experience will be considered.  -  -  At least 5 years and above of design experience.  -  -  Design experience must in electrical services in residential, commercial or mixed development projects..  -  -  Working Knowledge of softwares such as MS Office, AutoCAD, and Dialux & Revit MEP is a must.  -  -  Experience with leading project management /  Team Leaders would be an advantage.

column2: Job Description: Sr. Process Engineer- Offshore  We are looking for Senior- level role.  If you have a proven track record from offshore sector, this is your chance to step up. You will be part of passionate colleagues and cultured company, which is well known for delivering quality and best services.  Position:  Sr. Process Engineer Experience: 10+ years Position Purpose: Basic & detail Design Engineering activities for the assigned project(s) in Petrochemical Plants, Oil & Gas Plants, Offshore Drilling Rigs etc., in accordance with the Company established procedures.  Preparation / review of PFD, P&IDs, project specific specifications, design calculation / analysis, procurement specification.  Interface with other disciplines, user departments and Clients.  Estimation / engineering work related to bids.  Role & responsibilities:   Working as a lead/senior engineer in FEED/ Basic and Detail Engineering / EPC project.  Can produce and check processes deliverables like PFD/P&ID, Thermal design of Exchanger, separator, column design, utility package specifications.  Ensuring planned engineering (process) progress with respect to the engineering deliverables for Tenders (as required) and awarded Projects, process engineering planning & scheduling, preparation of progress reports, manpower & resource forecasts, time schedules of engineers, utilization of resources effectively & efficiently.  Process Design & Detail Engineering including performing process simulations, design calculations, Process Optimization, sizing & selection of equipment etc. for Tenders (as required) and for awarded Projects. Review of Clients tender documents, specifications, datasheets, verification of FEED design & calculations.  Preparation of various engineering deliverables (Drawings & Documents) such as Process Flow Diagrams, P & I Diagrams, Process Datasheets, Equipment Specifications, Cause & Effect Diagrams, control philosophies, shutdown philosophies, HAZOP Studies & reports, Operation & maintenance manuals etc. and providing necessary engineering inputs to the other disciplines and other departments.  Preparation & Issue of RFQs, evaluation of vendors quotations, clarifications, Technical Bid Analysis etc.  Review of vendors documents, drawings, datasheets, specifications and calculations. Knowledge and Skill set required for this role.   Essential Skills & Experience Qualification :   B.E. / B.TECH. / B.S.  CHEMICAL ENGINEERING Specialization in Petroleum / Petro Chemical Engineering preferred.  Preferred candidate profile     At least 10 years or more; relevant experience gained from a Offshore/Oil and Gas industry Experience multiple projects will be added advantage    Skill Set: Ability to work within a multi-disciplinary team including process, mechanical, structural, electrical, instrumentation and piping. Proven ability to collaborate with team members from project management, estimating, and project controls Strong organizational skills, technical competence, and attention to detail Know-how of Technology in chemicals/ Petrochemical process.  Process knowledge and ability to develop team. Familiarity with API/ISO/NFPA/OSHA standards as minimum.  Expertise in HTRI, Aspen - HYSYS simulation. Strong analytical skills and ability to produce coherent, self-explanatory reports such as technical documents, market research analysis and business advisory. Team Player

column1: Urgent job opening - Process Engineer, Chennai.
column2: Dear All, we have urgent requirement with Axiscades. Position: Process Engineer. Location : Chennai. Responsible for executing topsides process engineering activities for Produced Water Treatment, Sulphate removal Unit, Deaeration and vacuum generation package and Water Injection Systems (Enhanced Oil Recovery) within the budget and schedule, as well as maintaining technical integrity of the designs.  Developed Process Flow Diagrams (PFDs), Piping and Instrumentation Diagrams (P&IDs), Process Safety Flow Diagrams (PSFDs), Utility Flow Diagrams (UFDs), Heat and Material Balance.  Prepared package and equipment specifications, process descriptions, design basis, process datasheets, safe charts, cause & effect diagram and system engineering/operating manual.  Participated in P&ID design review, HAZOP meetings, produced water treatment package technology evaluation, vendor document design review etc. as required and closed out all action items.  Ensured all interfaces to partners and other disciplines are clearly defined and correctly engineered.  Evaluated discrepancies in design from design basis, specifications and scope of work and assisted in resolving the issues.  Reviewed sub-contractor deliverables and ensured that they conform to all applicable engineering codes and standards as well as the clients policies, procedures and guidelines.  Liaised with the Clients Engineering, Operations, Enhanced Oil Recovery Team, Maintenance staff and Project Management as required to ensure a consistent approach to project completion.  Carried out process simulation based on the production profile and performed process calculations for vessels, exchangers, pumps, control valves and relief devices.  Generated engineering drawings like P&IDs, PFDs and UFDs, process datasheets, Alarm and Trip Schedule, Line Designation Table and process package specifications.  Closed out design review, 3D model review and HAZOP action items.  Raised Design Change Notes, Technical Queries and provided process input to instruments, mechanical and piping. Interested candidates please send resume at renuka.y@axiscades.in
column11: Process Engineering, oil & Gas, Petrochemical

column2: The    Senior Process Engineer & EHS Specialist    is responsible for driving Process Engineering , process Safety initiatives EHS Programs and systems, continuous improvement projects within the facility ensuring that Ingredion Safety Procedures and systems are followed            Core Responsibilities:         Basic Engineering & Design - Basic engineering calculations for process plants & equipment, Material & Energy balance, preparations of PFDs & P&IDs, PDS of equipment, IPDS, plant & equipment layout of Chemical plants and Specialty chemicals Plants, Sizing & process design of equipment like heat exchangers, condensers, reactors with heating jackets, storage vessels & tanks etc., Conducting Front End Engineering Design, Detailed engineering projects.     Utility & Hydraulic calculations- Calculations of utility plant capacities such as boilers, water & wastewater treatment plants, chilling plants & compressed air requirement for actuated valves etc., preparation of utility summary., Pump hydraulic calculations, preparation of pump data sheets.     Process Control- Process Control logic & auto sequencing development, FAT of software & co-ordination with automation vendors.     Troubleshooting & Process Improvement - Managing pre commissioning, commissioning, erection of new project/Process. Troubleshooting, Process improvement managing process parameter so as to improve quality of product, minimizing time cycle.     Technology Transfer - Technology transfer & documentation, demonstration of laboratory batches, preparation of OPEX and CAPEX for technology    transfer.     EHS & Process Safety- Lead Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) on existing and new processes. Provide oversight for the site Management of Change (MOC) Process, Manage the site PHA schedule and recommendation implementation plan. Lead Root Cause Analysis (RCA) investigations for incidents and near misses. Provide oversight and conduct audits for Pre Startup Safety Reviews (PSSR). column2: We have recently won some major projects within the UK and overseas and as a result, we are seeking a    Senior Technical Robotic Engineer    to support the delivery of work packages for our prestigious automotive customers. Good understanding and knowledge of Robotic systems and industrial control systems in an automotive environment.          Good understanding and knowledge of industrial robotic safety functionality such as ABB SafeMove, Fanuc DCS, or KUKA SafeOperation          Ability to read Eplan schematics (Electrical, Mechanical and Pneumatic understanding). column1: Engineering Manager - Process and Industrial Sector
column2: The Project Engineering Manager will join the Engineering Management practice within the Technical Professional Organization (TPO) of Engineering Services Canada. The Project Engineering Manager will play a lead role in the delivery of Engineering Services on large and complex projects.      Reporting to the VP and Practice Lead, Engineering Management Practice, the Project Engineering Manager will contribute to the development of the project engineering strategy and directly lead the all or portions of large, multi-disciplinary projects and/or scopes of work from inception to completion.      In addition, the Engineering Manager will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including project managers, designers, stakeholders to deliver high-quality solutions that meet and exceed client expectations.      The ideal candidate will possess strong communication skills, technical expertise, hold a Professional Engineering credential and have at least 5 years leading multidisciplinary coordination of large engineering projects.          Responsibilities          Project Planning and Execution:          Collaborate with project managers to define engineering objectives, delivery schedules, and deliverables, ensuring alignment with client and project requirements and overall business objectives.      Oversee the delivery of the engineering project, including design, development, testing, and implementation, while coordinating resources effectively.      Ensure all deliverables and obligations associated with the scope of work are fully understood and identified.      Prepare and coordinate work hour estimates for the project and ensure respect of project budget and schedule.      Monitor project progress, identify, and mitigate risks, and resolve any issues or bottlenecks that may impact project timelines or quality.      Technical Expertise and Quality Assurance:      Provide technical guidance and expertise to the engineering team, ensuring the use of industry best practices and standards.      Prepare teams for reviews and quality assessments of engineering deliverables, ensuring compliance with project requirements, specifications, and quality standards.      Promote continuous improvement initiatives to enhance engineering processes, methodologies, and tools, driving efficiency and productivity.          Stakeholder Collaboration:          Collaborate closely with internal and external stakeholders, including clients, architects, contractors, and regulatory authorities, to ensure project success.      Engage in effective communication, providing regular project updates, addressing concerns, and managing expectations to foster strong client relationships.      Actively participate in meetings, presentations, and technical discussions, representing the engineering team and providing expert insights and recommendations.          Qualifications:          Bachelor s or master s degree in engineering or a related field with 15+ years of experience in a relevant field. Minimum 5 years of experience leading and co-ordinately multidisciplinary teams.      Ability to obtain relevant professional designation in multiple jurisdictions across Canada.      Strong technical expertise in a relevant engineering discipline, with a deep understanding of engineering principles, methodologies, and best practices.      Demonstrated people management skills, with the ability to unify and motivate team members to achieve project goals.      Exceptional problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a keen eye for detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality results.      Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex technical information to diverse audiences (both French and English are an asset).      Proven project management skills, including the ability to prioritize tasks, manage resources, and deliver projects within budget and on schedule.      Familiarity with relevant engineering software, tools, and technologies.

column1: Industry X - Aero Engineering - Fatigue & Damage Tolarence - 09
column2: Entity:- Accenture Industry X Practice:- Aero Engineering (Aerostructure) Title:- Engineering Services Specialist Role:- F&DT Engineering Job location:- Bangalore About Industry X:- Industry X combines Accenture's powerful digital capabilities with deep engineering and manufacturing expertise. We use the power of data and digital to help our clients reimagine the products they make, and how they make them. By connecting engineering and manufacturing operations every step of the way - from how products are designed and engineered, sourced and supplied, manufactured, to how they are serviced and renewed, we help them achieve greater productivity, drive growth and meet their sustainability commitments Know more:- www.youtube.com/watch?v=XaLxTEI3atI WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?  Performs Fatigue and Damage Tolerance analysis of aircraft structures using a broad range of standard hand, legacy and harmonized methods, responsible for checking various types of aircraft components and assemblies:Door Surround Structures, Side and Lower Shells, Pax and Cargo Floors, Skins, stringers, various clips, fasteners, joints and fittings etc.  To support Sizing & Justification phases. What you would do in this role  Experience in Sizing and justification of metallic/Composite primary and secondary aircraft structural components.  Experience in Door Surround Structures/Side shells/PAX and Cargo floors.  Expertise of Fatigue life calculation by using DFEM or ISAMI modules, Crack Propagation Analysis.  Expertise in ISAMI modules (Metallic Filled Hole, Composite Filled Hole, Lug analysis, Corin Analysis, Notch, Sensitivity, Damage Tolerance, Tension Fitting, Fatigue Spectrum Analysis (1D & 2D), Fatigue DFEM Initiation Modules, etc.,)  Experience with the use of both Finite Element (NASTRAN/PATRAN/HYPER MESH) and classical methods to perform structural load/Fatigue stress analysis for primary airframe structures is preferred.  Expertise in Sizing/Justification of aircraft components by providing the mitigation solution for critical components.  Experienced in documents (like PDR/CDR/Certification reports, Concessions, Repairs) and report creation and getting validated.  High level of customer and quality orientation together with strong abilities in consulting and implementation.  Experience on to industry standard verification & validation methods  Good written and oral communication skills in English.  Perform in a pressure environment and make quick yet meaningful decisions.  Continuous learning ability to understanding best practices in analysis and methodologies.  Good Knowledge on CATIA and experience in reading assembly drawings.  Strong Technical Report (Dossier) writing and checking skills.  Building, Leading, and guiding the team to execute the tasks.  F&DT quality check and Delivery responsibility.  Good experience in planning the training for freshers and experienced resources to fill the knowledge gap. Qualification Who are we looking for?  Overall 8 to 12 years of experience in Aerostructure domain  Minimum 9 years of Aerostructure F&DT Experience  Location:Bangalore  Education:BE/M.Tech in Mechanical, Aerospace, Aeronautical Engineering or relevant subject  Ability to Guide, work and lead the team.  Supporting continuous improvement initiatives to increase team efficiency.  Ability to liaise and with the teams across the department including Design and Stress.  Highly preferred A350/A350F primary and secondary structure experience with good knowledge of tools and methods.  Hypermesh, Nastran/Patran, ISAMI  Having VBA/Python programming is an added advantage. Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

This role acts as the discipline lead engineer for various proposals and projects and is responsible to deliver the work within contractual framework, quality, and schedule and overall cost effectiveness, in order to meet the overall project desired results. In this role, you will be responsible for: Developing and implementing industry-leading engineering practices, workflows, and procedures. Setting key performance indicators (KPIs) and benchmarks for accurate project estimations. Continuously improving engineering practices based on data-driven insights. Experience in EPC or Detail design engineering company in the engineering discipline for execution of projects in various sectors like Oil & Gas, Energy, Refining, Petrochemicals. column2: About Company        Founded in 2011, ReNew, is one of the largest renewable energy companies globally, with a leadership position in India. Listed on Nasdaq under the ticker RNW, ReNew develops, builds, owns, and operates utility-scale wind energy projects, utility-scale solar energy projects, utility-scale firm power projects, and distributed solar energy projects. In addition to being a major independent power producer in India, ReNew is evolving to become an end-to-end decarbonization partner providing solutions in a just and inclusive manner in the areas of clean energy, green hydrogen, value-added energy offerings through digitalisation, storage, and carbon markets that increasingly are integral to addressing climate change. With a total capacity of more than 13.4 GW (including projects in pipeline), ReNew?? solar and wind energy projects are spread across 150+ sites, with a presence spanning 18 states in India, contributing to 1.9 % of India?? power capacity. Consequently, this has helped to avoid 0.5% of India?? total carbon emissions and 1.1% India?? total power sector emissions. In the over 10 years of its operation, ReNew has generated almost 1.3 lakh jobs, directly and indirectly. ReNew has achieved market leadership in the Indian renewable energy industry against the backdrop of the Government of India?? policies to promote growth of this sector. ReNew?? current group of stockholders contains several marquee investors including CPP Investments, Abu Dhabi Investment Authority, Goldman Sachs, GEF SACEF and JERA. Its mission is to play a pivotal role in meeting India?? growing energy needs in an efficient, sustainable, and socially responsible manner. ReNew stands committed to providing clean, safe, affordable, and sustainable energy for all and has been at the forefront of leading climate action in India. column2: The Solar Performance Engineer will be based in the United States. The Solar Performance Engineer will work with the Nextracker team to analyze data in-field operations of Nextracker systems that will improve the Nextracker product portfolio and support customer success. He or she will work with a diverse and dedicated team of computer scientists and engineers to grow Nextrackers reach world-wide.             We are looking for someone who demonstrates:           Passionate drive to innovate and create          Integrity to the core         Enthusiastic customer focus         Consistent interactive teamwork          Desire for continuous improvement and top performance                Here is a glimpse of what you ll do          Drive TrueCapture field measurement and verification (M&V) activities for customers     Analyze and compare TrueCapture measured gains to quoted and modeled gains, investigate & resolve differences     Support ongoing evolution of analysis methods, data cleaning methods, automation, and processes to scale-up the calculation of TrueCapture measured gains.     Analyze customer performance data to accurately determine actual gains realized in the field     Actively monitor site performance during field tests to ensure quality data for analysis         Engage with customers to describe processes, present results, resolve doubts, and manage schedules, processes, and reporting requirements.     Concurrently manage several projects on various schedules for different customers each with unique challenges relating to data, customer satisfaction management, and operations     Support active monitoring and analyze solar resource, production, and operations data, enabling customer satisfaction via performance indicators and analysis       Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques; develop and provide ongoing reports       Build summaries and reports for data analytics on tracker system field performance.     Diagnose operational issues as appropriate using data analysis in collaboration with Nextracker technical services team         Create and manage processes to help scale data analysis/collection, dashboards, and reporting     Clean, filter, and manage operational datasets; identify data quality/integrity improvements and ensure they are properly addressed     Troubleshoot PV equipment, performance, or operational issues by leveraging data signatures             Here is some of what you ll need (required):           Bachelor s Degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or related discipline         Minimum 2 years of data science, performance engineering or analytics experience, working with large data sets         Minimum 2 years solar domain experience, preferably relating to the performance, design, operations and maintenance, and modeling of utility-scale solar power plants         Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with very strong attention to detail and accuracy         Familiar with performance engineering tools including PVsyst, PVLIB Python, NREL SAM, and other PV software, models, and tools         Solar industry specific experience regarding solar power plant operational performance, with understanding of system design, SCADA/DAS control and monitoring systems, remote communications, and common key performance indicators such as performance ratio, availability, production actual to budget, and related metrics         Foundational understanding of basic quantities and processes in solar performance including solar resource, sun position, irradiance, transposition models, analysis techniques, module technologies, inverter behaviors, and related topics         Experience working with time series datasets from operating power plants including data cleaning, validation, and understanding of key relationships between various physical quantities represented in the data         Excellent communication and presentation skills, thoroughness in investigations, and ability to juggle several in-progress projects and related schedules and milestones         Ability to develop, prioritize, and drive initiatives               Additional qualifications (preferred):           Master s degree is a plus         Experience accessing and handling large data sets, APIs, and ML analysis tools in Python         Knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, such as Power BI         Knowledge of statistics, and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets          Ability to identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets         Technical expertise regarding data models, data mining and segmentation techniques

column2: Hi We are hiring Process Engineer for big MNC Job Location : Remote or Bengaluru, Mumbai, Pune, Chennai, Delhi/NCR, Hyderabad Experience : 5 - 15 Years Salary : 5 - 20 LPA Process Engineer is responsible for designing, implementing, and optimizing industrial processes to improve efficiency, productivity, and quality while minimizing costs and environmental impact. work across various industries, including manufacturing, chemical, pharmaceutical, and energy, to develop and enhance production processes, equipment, and systems. Key Responsibilities: Process Design and Development:  Design, develop, and optimize manufacturing or production processes, including unit operations, equipment layouts, and workflow systems. Utilize engineering principles, mathematical models, and simulation tools to conceptualize and analyze process designs. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that process designs meet product specifications, quality standards, and regulatory requirements. Process Optimization:  Identify opportunities to improve process efficiency, productivity, and yield through data analysis, statistical modeling, and performance monitoring. Implement process improvements, modifications, or automation solutions to enhance throughput, reduce cycle times, and minimize waste. Conduct cost-benefit analyses to evaluate the feasibility and impact of proposed optimizations. Equipment Selection and Specification:  Select and specify appropriate equipment, instruments, and technologies for process operations, considering factors such as capacity, reliability, safety, and cost-effectiveness. Collaborate with equipment vendors, suppliers, and contractors to procure and install process equipment in accordance with project requirements and specifications. Process Troubleshooting and Problem-Solving:  Identify and resolve process-related issues, deviations, or failures through root cause analysis, troubleshooting methodologies, and corrective action implementation. Collaborate with operations, maintenance, and quality teams to address process disruptions, equipment malfunctions, or product defects in a timely manner. Quality Assurance and Control:  Develop and implement quality assurance protocols, control strategies, and validation procedures to ensure that processes meet regulatory requirements and quality standards. Conduct process audits, inspections, and risk assessments to identify compliance gaps and areas for improvement. Implement corrective and preventive actions to address quality issues and deviations. Safety and Environmental Compliance:  Ensure that process designs and operations comply with safety regulations, environmental standards, and industry best practices. Conduct process hazard analyses (PHA), safety reviews, and risk assessments to identify and mitigate potential hazards, safety risks, and environmental impacts. Implement safety measures, protocols, and training programs to promote a culture of safety and environmental stewardship. Documentation and Reporting:  Maintain accurate documentation of process designs, specifications, operating procedures, and validation records. Prepare technical reports, presentations, and documentation for internal use, regulatory submissions, and client communication. Communicate project updates, findings, and recommendations to stakeholders and project teams effectively. Continuous Improvement:  Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance process performance, reliability, and sustainability. Identify opportunities for innovation, technology adoption, and process standardization to optimize operations and reduce costs. Participate in cross-functional teams, knowledge-sharing activities, and professional development opportunities to stay updated on industry trends and best practices.

column2: Process Crystallization Expert: Seeking a talented and experienced Process Crystallization Scientist/Engineer to join our team. The successful candidate will play a key role in the development and optimization of crystallization processes for pharmaceutical compounds, with a focus on achieving desired product characteristics, such as purity, particle size, and crystal form. This position offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the advancement of drug development programs and support our clients' goals. Job Responsibilities: Crystallization Process Development:  Design and optimize crystallization processes for pharmaceutical compounds, including a selection of appropriate solvents, antisolvents, and crystallization conditions to achieve desired product properties. Experimental Design and Execution:  Plan and conduct experiments to screen and optimize crystallization parameters, such as temperature, cooling rate, seeding, and agitation, using laboratory-scale equipment. Also, hands-on PAT tools such as FBRM, PVM, React-IR and Raman  Characterization and Analysis:  Analyse crystalline products using various analytical techniques, such as X-ray diffraction (XRD), differential scanning calorimetry (DSC), and microscopy, to assess crystal form, purity, and particle size distribution. Scale-up and Technology Transfer:  Scale up optimized crystallization processes from laboratory to pilot plant and manufacturing scale, ensuring robust and reproducible performance. Collaborate with MSAT and production teams to facilitate technology transfer and process validation activities. Process Optimization and Troubleshooting:  Continuously monitor and optimize crystallization processes to improve product quality, yield, and efficiency. Identify and troubleshoot process deviations and implement corrective actions as needed. Regulatory Compliance:  Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards for pharmaceutical manufacturing, including cGMP guidelines, by maintaining accurate documentation and following established procedures. Collaboration and Communication:  Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including formulation scientists, analytical chemists, and regulatory affairs professionals, to support integrated drug development projects. Communicate project updates, findings, and recommendations to internal stakeholders and external clients. Qualifications: Bachelors, Masters, or Ph.D. degree in Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Pharmaceutical Sciences, or a related field. Minimum of 5-15 years of experience in process development and optimization, with a focus on crystallization, preferably in the pharmaceutical industry or a related field. Strong understanding of crystallization principles, nucleation kinetics, and crystalline polymorphism. Hands-on experience with laboratory-scale crystallization equipment and analytical techniques for solid-state characterization. Familiarity with statistical experimental design (DOE), QbD and process modelling tools for optimization and scale-up. Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work effectively in a team-based environment. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across functional groups and communicate technical information effectively.   About Syngene  Incorporated in 1993, Syngene International Ltd. is an innovation-focused global discovery, development and manufacturing organization providing integrated scientific services to the pharmaceutical, biotechnology, nutrition, animal health, consumer goods and specialty chemical industries around the world. Syngene s clientele includes world leaders such as Bristol-Myers Squibb, Baxter, Amgen, GSK, Merck KGaA and Herbalife. Its innovative culture is driven by the passion of its 4240- strong team of scientists who work with clients from around the world to solve their scientific problems, improve R&D productivity, speed up time to market and lower the cost of innovation.   Equal Opportunity Employer:  It is the policy of Syngene to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable legislation or local law. In addition, Syngene will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

column2: .   Job Title: Process Engineer Job Summary:  As a Process Engineer, you will be responsible for optimizing industrial processes to ensure efficiency, quality, and safety. You will analyze existing processes, identify areas for improvement, and implement solutions to enhance productivity and reduce costs. Collaboration with cross-functional teams, adherence to regulatory standards, and continuous monitoring of process performance are integral aspects of this role. Key Responsibilities: 1.  Process Optimization:  Analyze existing processes to identify inefficiencies and opportunities for improvement. Develop and implement strategies to optimize workflow, increase productivity, and reduce waste. 2.  Comos:  In COMOS, data maintenance typically involves managing and updating various types of engineering data related to plant design, construction, operation, and maintenance throughout the lifecycle of a plant. This data can include: * Piping and instrumentation diagrams (P&IDs) : These diagrams depict the piping and instrumentation of a process, including equipment, instrumentation, and control systems. In COMOS, you would maintain and update P&IDs to reflect any changes or revisions to the plant design. *Process Flow Diagram (PFD) : In engineering, a Process Flow Diagram (PFD) is a schematic representation of a process system showing the equipment, flow paths, and major piping and instrumentation details.  * Equipment data : This includes information about various equipment used in the plant, such as pumps, compressors, vessels, and heat exchangers. Data maintenance involves updating equipment specifications, performance data, and maintenance schedules as needed. Instrumentation data : COMOS helps manage data related to instrumentation and control systems, including instrument specifications, loop diagrams, and control strategies. 3.   Study the equipment:  Understanding the purpose, operation, and maintenance requirements of each piece of equipment is essential for optimizing process efficiency and ensuring safety and quality standards are met,  Material Handling Equipment, Mixing Equipment,   Heat Transfer Equipment,   Separation of Equipment, Reaction Vessels

column2: In the role of Principal Process Engineer, you are responsible for contributing to the expertise and knowledge within the Process discipline, develop/improve corporate process engineering calculation tools and guidelines and provide support to all ongoing brownfield and greenfield projects executed in our Bengaluru office                                                                          You will work in conjunction with Discipline Manager, Discipline Leads and Project Managers to seek continuous improvement in both quality and efficiency of work. Lead/attend design review meetings and participate in HAZOP review meetings.                                          Evaluating and incorporating project Lessons Learned to improve process engineering guidelines and work instructions.                                          Act as consultant and mentor to less experienced engineers to ensure knowledge transfer, product memory, and application of best engineering practices.                                        . Furthermore, the principal process engineer shall have the following skills and experience:                                        Strong knowledge of process engineering and process safety fundamentals as well as preparation of quality engineering documents.                                          Collaborate with others to propose/optimize methodologies for engineering activities and working methods to enable fast-track project execution.                                          Perform activities in compliance with SBM Group Technical Standards, Engineering Standards, corporate Processes and Work Instructions.                                          Checking/Preparation of all Process Calculations for Equipment sizing, Line sizing, Pump Hydraulics, PSV sizing, Blowdown etc.                                          Capable of managing a team of process engineers (typically 10+ engineers)                                          Capable of coaching and developing less experienced engineers and to guide experienced engineers with changes in engineering methods and work processes.                                          Development of PFD, P&ID, Equipment Datasheets, Instrument Datasheets, SAFE Charts, Cause & Effect Diagrams and Process Safeguarding documentation                                                                                          Conversant with relevant international standards applicable to hydrocarbon processing industry, such as API, ISO, ASME, IEC, etc.                                          Familiar with design review methods, such as HAZID, HAZOP, SIL Assessment                                          Good experience in steady state & dynamic simulation of Oil & Gas plant (using Hysys or UniSim software)                                          Having good experience in the offshore Oil & Gas industry with specific experience on Process Simulation and Design for Offshore Oil and Gas facilities Wellhead platforms, Fixed Process Platforms, FPSO topsides modules & Turret Mooring System                                          Review of vendor documents and technical bid evaluation                                          Assess potential risks to integrated process & utilities and develop initiatives- taking mitigation strategies to minimize project disruptions, including during commissioning, start-up, and early operations. SW or tools:              HYSYS, UNISIM, PIPESIM, FLARENET, PIPENET etc.                                            Behaviours &inter-personal skills - Key points:                Soft skills                                          Effective team player                                              Good communication skills                                              Strong analytical skills                                            A pro-active approach and not afraid to take initiative and/or explore new ideas.                                            Autonomous and able to think out of the box.

Understanding and implementation of process parameters, process      control strategies, and process safety measures including interlocks. Designing Equipment and Plant Layouts, as well as Piping Layouts      for various types of process plants including Power Plants, Chemical      Plants, Oil & Gas Facilities, and Petrochemical Plants. Coordination of interface engineering and terminal points to ensure      seamless integration of systems. Experience with Packaged Systems including Water & Effluent      Treatment, Desalination, HVAC, Hydrogen, and Oil and Gas treatment. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to conceptualise, design,      and implement cutting-edge hydrogen system processes that align with      sustainability goals and regulatory standards.  Assist with training other engineers by providing instruction on      new technologies and/or a specialization Activities will involve one or      more of the following: PID and PFD development, Heat and Material      Balances, Hydraulic Calculations, Relief Valve Sizing, Line Sizing, Pump      Sizing, etc. Compilation of Equipment and Line Lists, sizing, specifications,      and data sheets for Static and Rotary equipment such as pumps,      compressors, fans, heat exchangers, and vessels. Conduct comprehensive process simulations and modelling to assess      the efficiency, feasibility, and safety of various hydrogen system      components.  Analyse data and perform in-depth technical evaluations to identify      areas for process improvement and optimization, aiming for enhanced energy      efficiency and reduced environmental impact.  Collaborate with external partners, research institutions, and      industry stakeholders to stay updated on the latest advancements in      hydrogen system technologies and contribute to the company's thought      leadership.  Assist in the preparation of technical reports, presentations, and      documentation to communicate results, insights, and progress to both      internal and external audiences. Knowledge of at least one specific aspect of hydrogen as an energy      vector such as hydrogen mobility, syngas production and utilisation or      Carbon Capture and Storage (CCS).  Proficiency in process simulation tools (e.g., Aspen Plus, HYSYS)      and other relevant software. column2: Role and Responsibilities Capable of independently doing process engineering calculations.  Should be capable to prepare PFDs, UFDs, heat and mass balances and P&IDs. Preparation of process datasheets for equipment and instrument, including package units. Performing hydraulic calculations, preparing line list, sizing and selection of various process equipment like pumps, compressors, vessels, separators, etc. Sizing of control valves and relief valves. Thermal design of heat exchangers. Flare philosophy, flare load calculations and flare network analysis simulation. Process Control Philosophy/ narrative, shutdown philosophy, functional specifications, sequence description, cause and effect diagram, operation manual, etc. Review and & update of P&IDs through various stages of projects. Review of General Arrangement drawings and ISOs. Participate in Hazop study and close out. Preparation of design change notes. Qualifications and Education Requirements Necessary:  Degree in Chemical Engineering. Desirable:  More than 15 years of relevant experience. Preferred Skills 1. Experience in process design of oil & gas industry that includes FEED and Detail Engineering.  2. Experience in designing of Tank Farm and LNG plant will be an added advantage. 3. Strong organizational, collaboration and leadership skills. 4. Good Knowledge of process simulation software like Aspen-Hysys, HTRI, Flarenet, Pipesim, etc. 5. Good knowledge of various international codes and standards like API, ANSI, ASME, TEMA, etc. 6. Coordinate with other departments for changes through various stages of P&ID. 7. Should have good experience in review of 3D models. 8. Should be capable of responding to site technical queries. 9. Review and Evaluate vendor documents and suggest necessary changes. Ability to guide the process engineer and process designer

column2: Hi all  we are hiring for a aerospace company   Job Title: Process Engineer (with CAM Background) Location:  Bangalore, India Working Days and Time:  6 days a week (2nd and 4th Saturday off), 8:30 AM to 6:00 PM Notice Period:  Maximum 60 days Interview Process:  Face-to-Face interviews only. Job Brief: We are seeking an experienced Process Engineer with a CAM background to join our team. The successful candidate will play a key role in translating engineering designs and specifications into efficient and effective manufacturing processes. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure that products are manufactured to meet the exact requirements outlined in the provided build-to-print documentation. Your responsibilities will include process optimization, quality assurance, and continuous improvement initiatives. Responsibilities: Review and Interpretation: Review and interpret engineering drawings, specifications, and build-to-print documentation for manufacturing processes. Ensure a thorough understanding of customer requirements and design specifications. Process Design and Optimization: Design and develop manufacturing processes based on build-to-print requirements to ensure accurate and repeatable production. Continuously optimize processes to improve efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance product quality. Quality Assurance: Implement quality control measures to ensure that manufacturing processes adhere to build-to-print specifications. Conduct regular inspections and audits to verify compliance with quality standards. Collaboration: Work closely with production teams and other stakeholders to resolve any discrepancies or challenges in build-to-print documentation. Collaborate on design reviews to provide input on manufacturability and process feasibility. Documentation and Compliance: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of manufacturing processes, changes, and deviations in compliance with build-to-print documentation. Ensure that all processes adhere to relevant industry standards and regulations. Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for continuous improvement in manufacturing processes. Implement and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of process enhancements. Training and Knowledge Transfer: Provide training to production personnel on build-to-print specifications and requirements. Facilitate knowledge transfer between engineering and production teams to enhance process understanding. Cost Management: Analyze manufacturing costs and develop strategies to optimize spending while maintaining build-to-print requirements. Identify cost-effective solutions for production processes. Requirements: Bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field. 3+ years of proven experience in process engineering within a build-to-print manufacturing environment. Strong knowledge of interpreting engineering drawings and build-to-print documentation. Familiarity with Lean Manufacturing principles and continuous improvement methodologies. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills. Proficiency in GD&T symbols on engineering drawings to communicate geometric tolerances and specifications effectively. Interested candidates can share their resumes to thanuja@delighthr.com. Thanks and Regards, Thanuja.CH Executive Talent Acquisition Delight HR Services Pvt Ltd. Bangalore-560102
column11: Collaboration, Cost Management, Interpretation, Quality Assurance, Cam, Documentation, Process Design, process engineer, Optimization

column2: Reporting to the Facility Manager, process engineer is responsible for the day-to-day operation and technical support of the SMR, and ASU based on the Air Products Barauni Plant and ensuring production and efficiency targets are being achieved safely. The facility range across multiple technologies such as Hydrogen (HYCO) and Air Separation (ASU).         ?                                                       PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES                 A high regard for the safety of self and others.             Understand and have working knowledge of Air Products EHS systems processes including emergency preparedness and incident management.             Identify productivity improvement opportunities and targets in production operations. Areas of emphasis includes manufacturing cost reduction, waste handling and reduction, raw materials, utilities consumption/cost/supply, production process reliability and capacity expansions.                 Conduct process engineering evaluation of production unit operations and facility utilities, investigate and identify process bottlenecks and constraints, map system capability and rank solutions with necessary cost-benefit analyses.             Identify, develop and design improved operating and control strategies to achieve productivity targets. Develop tracking programs and metrics for plant optimization and efficiency and monitor the targets against budget/expected performance.                 Analyze plant performance and work with the operations team to ensure the plant operates optimally. Develop and install systems that ensure plant operators and line management understand the optimal run point for each process to achieve efficiency targets. Develop training modules and assist in training operators.             Providing Plant Process Engineering support in the following areas:             Knowledge of applicable standards, design tools and work processes.     Some ORI/Commissioning experience and experienced in defrosting/restarting (where applicable) and can do this on the plants they support with limited assistance.     Contributor in OPHRs and DHRs and ensures efficient action closeout.             Provide support for the facility process safety activities through implementation of management of change associated with asset management projects, operating plant hazard review revalidation, execution of project hazards reviews, completing OPHR action items, and support of environmental permitting.                 Provide process-engineering consultation and support to the site Production organization, to help troubleshoot and resolve process operating problems. Assist operations to resolve product quality, reliability, and operability issues.             Provide engineering support in conjunction with plant turnarounds.                 Actively participate in plant safety program by attending monthly meetings and assisting with BSP program compliance.             Provide technical support to ensure the safe and reliable operation of equipment, processes, utilities, and controls is achieved.                 Provide technical leadership in supporting/leading investigations and Root Cause Analysis in order to identify implement sustainable corrective actions.             Responsible for the day-to-day operation of the plants in 8-hour shifts, including troubleshooting plant process problems, directly supervising daily plant activities and reporting to management. The Shift Engineer is required to be able to start up, shutdown or put the process into a safe position, escalating any abnormal situations to the Plant Supervisor.             Support the commissioning of the Barauni plants to ensure the start-up is successful; the plants are properly handed over to Operations in accordance with Air Products standards and all outstanding testing, work and punch list items identified with a path to closure.                     MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS                     bachelors degree in chemical engineering with 5-7 years experience in engineering or technical services in Ammonia, Hydrogen or Methanol process industries.             Experience and knowledge in the technology, design, and operation of Steam Methane Reformers (HYCO), Ammonia and Air Separation preferred.     Start-up, commissioning, or plant operating experience an advantage             Excellent Communication skills.             Able to handle communication with customer.             Good technical knowledge in gas operations and engineering.             Fluent oral English and excellent written English.             Knowledge of Hindi will be an added advantage
column11: Product quality, Unit operations, Plant commissioning, Production operations, Cost reduction, Process safety, Refinery, Asset management, IOCL, Technical support

column2: Job Description:  Apply basic chemical engineering principals of heat transfer, vapor-liquid equilibria, mass transfer and thermodynamics in process design. Perform design calculations using standard simulation programs  (Hysys, Pro II, Unisim, and/or Promax). Conversant in relief calculation methodologies and industry codes and standards applicable to pressure relief design. Develop relief load narratives, relief load calculations and relief valve datasheets. Develop flare system design. Proficient in the process design of equipment, including vessels, columns, heat exchangers and package process specifications for equipment and control valves. Develop process engineering deliverables such as  BFDs, PFDs, H&MBs,  Equipment Datasheets, Utility Summaries and other process deliverables required for the facility design. Knowledgeable in alarm and trip setpoint rationale and process safety time calculations. Develop and check Piping & Instrumentation Diagrams (P&IDs), from preliminary drawings to issue for construction. Develop and check Line Designation Tables (line lists with process and mechanical design conditions captured). Perform and check hydraulic calculations for pumps, compressors, control valves, and line sizing. Develop and check Design Pressure and Temperature Diagrams (DPDTs) including analyzing and determining piping systems design conditions. Participate in Plot Plan,  3D Mode l and P&ID Reviews. Participate in safety reviews  (HAZID, HAZOP/ SIL) , as well as reviewing compliance with applicable safety and quality standards. Review deliverables from licensors, other disciplines, and suppliers during the execution of the project to ensure that process intent has been adequately incorporated into the facility design.

column2: This role is part of Arcadis Global Excellence Centre (GEC) and will join our 3,000+ talented individuals working in India, Romania, and Philippines, in partnership with Arcadis offices globally     The GEC brings key capabilities and capacity to support our clients seamlessly around the world     For those in GEC there are options to be dedicated to one country; developing deep knowledge and strong relationships, as well as opportunities to be part of teams working truly globally as a centre of excellence, offering diversity and variety     Arcadians are by nature, globally minded and culturally aware, and Arcadis strongly believes in flexibility which enables change over time as your career progresses     The GEC model is well embedded in Arcadis, and the strong relationships that exist between our global offices are truly unique.            Arcadis is looking for a Process Design Wastewater Engineer (Industrial Biological Wastewater Treatment Engineer) to join our Industrial Water team to support design of aerobic and anaerobic wastewater treatment systems.     In this role, you will utilize your expertise, technical knowledge, and client relationships to successfully execute projects for a variety of industries including Food & Beverage, Life Science, Pulp & Paper, Oil & Gas, Chemical, Aerospace, Automotive, Technology.      Projects ranging from feasibility studies through detailed design and construction support.      Experience working within front-end loading project delivery models is key for many of our projects and clients.      Depending on the project, you will be expected fill one or more roles including technical project manager, design manager, process and/or process mechanical lead (wastewater), and/or quality reviewer.     Additionally, you will have the opportunity to mentor engineers and serve as a line manager within the Industrial Water group         Role accountabilities:         The Process Design Wastewater Engineer (Industrial Biological Wastewater Treatment Engineer) is primarily responsible for leading or supporting the design of biological wastewater treatment systems. Activities can include preliminary and detailed process sizing calculations using industry standard calculations (eg Eckenfelder, ASM, ADM) or modeling software (eg GPS-XTM); development and oversight of bench and pilot treatability testing; support to be provided to Global team for preparation of feasibility, concept, and basis of design reports; preparation of process diagrams, mass balances, and process and instrumentation diagrams; and preparation of process control descriptions/narratives.         Other responsibilities may include:         Executing projects and provide technical engineering support to global team for developing PFD, P&ID, Equipment layout, 3D models.     Coordinate execution of projects with other disciplines.     Manage and lead condition assessment evaluations for industrial biological wastewater system assets.     Support the creation of cost estimates and project schedules and be responsible for completing design tasks within budget and on schedule.     Manage and lead the growth of client relationships.     Supervise and support the work of others and mentor junior-level engineers and other technical staff.     Ensure project compliance with all Arcadis practices and quality and safety standards.         Qualifications & Experience:         8-10 years of industrial wastewater experience.     bachelors / masters Degree in Chemical / Environmental Engineering or a related field of study with focus on biological wastewater treatment.         Key Skills/Attributes         Ability to effectively discuss project issues with Global team suppliers/vendors, to deliver technical presentations for team.     Experience managing preparation of and reviewing and approving project drawings, specifications, schedules, and cost estimates.     Excellent technical engineering and project/task management skills in the water/wastewater practice area.     Client relationship skills; including preparation and development of proposals and client management experience with a successful track record of delivering various engineering projects to the expectations of the client.     Functional experience with MS Office applications.     Self-motivated.         Preferred Qualifications         Ceng License shall be preferred.     Experience with biological wastewater process modelling and other specialized software packages added advantage.     Deep understanding of biological wastewater treatment process and process mechanical design including pump sizing, hydraulics, piping and rack layout, pressure relief device sizing, etc     Active participation in industrial committees within regional or national professional associations

column2: As part of process engineering, the primary focus is on designing and optimizing the processes involved in the production or treatment of materials within industrial facilities.    This includes hydrocarbons, chemical plants, power plants, and water treatment plants.                      Developing and optimizing chemical and physical processes involved in the production or treatment of materials.    Specifying the unit operations, equipment, and technologies necessary for the desired transformations.            Material and Energy Balances        Perform calculations to ensure efficient use of resources and optimal process performance. Identify opportunities for energy recovery and integration to enhance overall energy efficiency.            Process Flow Diagrams (PFDs)          Create PFDs to visually represent the major equipment and flow paths within the process. Use PFDs to communicate the overall process concept and identify key components.          Piping and Instrumentation Diagrams (P&IDs)            Develop detailed P&IDs that illustrate the interconnection of process equipment, instrumentation, and control systems. Specify the details of piping, valves, instruments, and other components.        Reaction Engineering (for Chemical Plants)            Design and optimize chemical reactions and reactors. Consider factors such as reaction kinetics, thermodynamics, and catalysis to achieve desired product specifications.        Operational Safety and Environment Compliance                  Conduct process hazard analysis (PHA) and implement safety measures to mitigate risks. Design safety systems, relief systems, and safe start-up and shutdown procedures.    Implement systems for the treatment and control of emissions, effluents, and waste.    Ensure smooth transitions between operational states to avoid process upsets.                        Use process simulation software to model and analyse the behaviour of the process under different conditions. Optimize process parameters for efficiency, yield, and product quality.          Control System Design              Develop control strategies and design the instrumentation and control systems to monitor and regulate the processes. Implement distributed control systems (DCS) or programmable logic controllers (PLC) as needed.              Continuous Improvement & Collaboration                Establish monitoring systems to collect data for ongoing process optimization. Implement improvements based on performance data and feedback from operations. Work closely with the client to understand their specific requirements and expectations to meet operational and business goals.                AutoCAD Plant 3D    Why TAAL Tech?    Transparent, agile, flexible and well-aligned engagement approach      Nurturing engineering partnerships for    15+ years      Dependable and reliable delivering success on time, every time      Well-established processes and frameworks to ensure 100% compliance      High focus on talent acquisition, management and development      Innovative solutions with cutting-edge technology and forward-thinking strategies      Secure better project outcomes & improved ROI with TAAL Tech s digitized engineering support. Get started now!

column2: Company Overview:                                  At Lummus Technology, innovation, excellence and family values are extremely important to us. We bring our employees together with the work that we do, the technology that we develop, and the training and development initiatives we support.                              Unlike most companies, we have low turnover, and we retain our amazing employees because of the unique way we work together. Our people are some of the smartest, most dedicated and capable people in our industry. The biggest reason we are so successful is because we truly care about each other, and that is why we are special. Many of us have spent our entire career at Lummus; we take pride in our history, our current success, and our future is bright.                              Knowledge transfer and mentoring are essential in order to ensure our employees success for the future. As a new employee, you will receive in-depth technical training, growth, and support from brilliant technology leaders that are world renown for their expertise. As part of a global company, you will have the opportunity to work with people with extremely diversified backgrounds.                                Job Overview:                                  The Process Safety Engineer manages Lummus Technology s process safety management (PSM) programs as they apply to the basic engineering design of chemical, petrochemical, and refining facilities. This professional also works with project design teams providing guidance and consulting on specific project-related process safeguarding systems design on a day-to-day basis. This professional also administers Lummus Technology s plant visit safety procedure.                                  Key Responsibilities:                                      Provide oversight, review, and development of Lummus Technology s PSM policies, procedures, practices, standards and tools                                      Participate in project process safety reviews and provide team leadership as required (eg, HAZOP facilitator)                                      Perform process risk analyses as needed to support the design of process safeguarding systems                                      Design overpressure protection and relief systems particularly for reactive systems in accordance with DIERS methodology                                      Determine the performance requirements of safety instrumented systems in accordance with ISA and IEC standards and client requirements                                      Prepare narrative of process safety design considerations for project basic engineering documentation                                      Maintain working knowledge of relevant industry PSM regulations, codes, standards, and industry recommended practices                                      Train and mentor process design engineers and other engineering disciplines in various PSM areas with emphasis on hazard identification and process safeguarding system design                                      Act as a liaison with all Lummus Technology offices worldwide and third party detailed engineering contractors to resolve PSM problems on specific projects                                      Administer and manage Lummus Technology s plant visit safety program applicable to all Lummus Technology employees expected to visit any client facility.                                                       Basic Requirement:       12-18 years of industrial experience in refinery or petrochemical plant operations and a minimum of seven (7) years experience as shift-in-charge of a plant/manager.     Operational experience in ethylene plants and/or multiple petrochemical technologies would be preferred. 2-3 years process design experience is added plus.     Experience as Licensor representative on projects is preferable.     Experience in technologies licensed by Lummus is preferable.     The ability to plan, coordinate, and supervise the activities at site during construction completion, pre-commissioning, commissioning, startup and initial operation activities.     A working knowledge of plant operations, maintenance and multidisciplinary functions.     Must be able to communicate with his/ her manager effectively, take concurrence and execute accordingly.     Ability to work in an individual capacity or in a team     Must have general awareness of health, safety and environment practices.     Adaptable to different HSE standards and practices by different clients.     Strong written and verbal communication skills and proficiency in basic Microsoft office applications       Travel and Work Schedules:       The individual would be required to travel extensively (more than 60%) and at short notice.     He / She would be required to remain at site locations for extended periods, away from the home office.     The individual should be able to meet client/project demands and willing to accommodate last minute changes to schedules       Desired/Preferred Qualifications:       A bachelors degree preferably in chemical engineering or equivalent in refinery, petrochemical or chemicals.
column11: Process design, Chemical engineering, Consulting, Manager Technology, System design, Process safety, Engineering Design, PSM, Petrochemical, Petroleum

column2: Key Responsibilities    Candidate is Preferred to have hands on experience during Process safety Implementation  (Dupont/CCPS/OSHA) in their organization and good in tracking Leading/Lagging indicator for PSM.    The Process Safety Candidate must be capable of identifying process hazards, evaluating the risk of  those hazards, and assist in the development of effective solutions to mitigate risk.    Strong Knowledge of Reaction like Hydrogenation, Oxidation, Grignard Reaction and Vacuum Distillation.    Knowledge about various process equipment, Utility equipment like Compressor, Chiller, Boiler, N2  Plant, Vacuum system, Reactor, HE, Dist. Column etc., its operation and expected hazards during  operation.    Able to conduct what-if and HAZOP study as chairman.    The Process Safety Candidate must be familiar with the fourteen elements of Process Safety  Management (PSM) and the EPAs Risk Management Plan (RMP) rule.    Preference will be given to Process Safety candidates familiar with NFPA 30; IL state pressure vessel  requirements; IL state atmospheric storage tank requirements; and experience interfacing with  insurance carriers (Factory Mutual).   The Chemical Process Safety Candidate responsibilities may include the following:   Lead Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) on existing and new processes.   Provide oversight for the site Management of Change (MOC) Process   Manage the site PHA schedule and recommendation implementation plan.   Lead Root Cause Analysis (RCA) investigations for incidents and near misses.    Provide oversight and conduct audits for Pre-Startup Safety Reviews (PSSR)    Provide mentoring and training for site personnel.    Participate on teams responsible to implement new products and processes.    Good Experience in understanding P&IDs with respect to various equipment, instruments, and  processes.      Ability to review P&IDs from a safety perspective and provide comments to the design team.   Experience in understanding logic and interlocks with respect to various systems.  Experience in hazard identification and protective device sizing with respect to various processes.    Co-ordinate with project execution team on process safety requirement communication & support.    Should be able to handle and manage various stakeholders in the project.   Good communication skill is a must and should be good in technical writing in English. Communicate with onsite/offshore team for executing the projects.    Establish and maintain an awareness of HS&E across the discipline within assigned.    To Determine the Major Accident Hazard events and to apply a formalized approach of Hazard.   Management to identify and provide means of mitigation and reduction of such hazards

column2: We are recruiting a Senior Process Engineer to join our Water & Energy Business, with a focus on both water and wastewater process and industry and municipal treatment      Experience of Energy, or other industries would be of interest      The role can be based in any of our GEC offices                  Role accountabilities:          Undertake process design work on projects as required, supervise, and check the work of assigned engineers as appropriate.      Develop the basis of design according to needs, undertake detailed calculations to develop the design and be responsible for the accuracy of these calculations.      Ensure that detail design methods, standards and data used conform with Clients requirements and / the Arcadis Way of Design and Engineering.      Bringing or building a strong profile in the industry and keeping up to date with innovations and developments.      Support our digital strategy whilst keeping abreast of the technology within the market.      Working independently as well as with team on various projects in line with client requirements.      Support in the training and development of junior engineers in the team.      Ensure a high standard of safety is achieved and Environmental and Quality Assurance procedures are followed.      Analyse data to evaluate the performance of existing client s assets and develop site condition reports      Develop process flow diagrams and mass balances including the interfaces and basic hydraulics between process units.      Production of control philosophies and commissioning plans.      Develop process and performance specifications.      Perform safety related calculations and provide input to HAZOPs, SIL and other safety reviews as directed      Liaise with other Engineering Disciplines by contributing to the review of supplier quotations, the project 3D CAD model and other multi-disciplinary project activities.      Keep up to date with developments in the industry sector and with technical and legislative developments and seek out opportunities to develop a strong professional profile at a National level (e.g. conference presentations, publications and participation in technical committees).      Lead by example to promote continual improvement in SHE performance across the business.      Work in a flexible manner with our various clients.      Willingness to do secondments with different clients.              Qualifications & Experience:          A Bachelor s and/or Master s degree in Chemical or Environmental Engineering, or equivalent, is essential.      A minimum of 8-12 years of total experience within the process engineering field.      Sufficient and appropriate adeptness in process engineering (process design), preferably in regulated water but possibly in other relevant fields within the utilities and power sector.      Experience in (at least two of them) drinking water, wastewater and sludge treatment processes.      Chartered or working towards becoming a Member of IChemE or equivalent institution.      Have experience, including participation in the development and implementation of technological and innovative solutions, in the field of process engineering.      The ability to be client facing whilst working collaboratively to form strong working relationships with colleagues and customers.      Take responsibility to work on own initiative and seek assistance when required.      Knowledge, learning and development around digital tools, such as process modelling, simulators and others

column2: About Us At Technip Energies, we believe in a better tomorrow, and we believe we can make tomorrow better.  With approximately 15,000 talented women and men, we are a global and leading engineering and technology company, with a clear vision to accelerate the energy transition.  Designing and delivering added value energy solutions is what we do. Assist with Quality Audits . Field experience including troubleshooting, start-up, commissioning, etc. would be a plus. About You: Bachelors degree in Chemical Engineering is required. Minimum 7 - 15 years of chemical process engineering experience in similar EPC environment for Onshore / Offshore projects. Inclusion Standards  In our continuous journey to developing and building culture of inclusion, we adhere to four Inclusion Gold Standards. And you?  We challenge our biases and embrace diversity of thought.  No one has all the knowledge and solutions, collectively we do.  We foster a caring environment where people are respected, comfortable to share and be heard.  We promote active listening for effective decision and action. Whats Next? We ask for your patience as the team completes the volume of applications with reasonable timeframe.  Check your application progress periodically via personal account from created candidate profile during your application. We invite you to get to know more about our company by visiting www.technipenergies.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Youtube for company updates.
