column2: To ensure the structural integrity, safety, and efficiency of engineering projects through accurate analysis, design, and optimization of structures and piping systems, while adhering to industry standards, codes, project specifications, regulatory requirements, and best practices.                          ?           Essential Functions/Responsibilities                            ?           1. Structural Analysis and Design:                      Utilize STAAD.Pro software for structural analysis and design of various types of structures, including Modular Structural Skids, Equipment support structures, and industrial facilities.              Develop structural designs that meet safety, stability, and performance requirements while optimizing material usage and construction costs.                      2. Pipeline Stress Analysis:                      Use CAESAR II software for pipeline stress analysis to evaluate the behaviour of piping systems under various operating conditions, including thermal expansion, pressure loads, and external forces.              Ensure pipelines are designed to withstand stresses and displacements within allowable limits to prevent structural failure or leakage.                      3. Modeling and Simulation:                      Create accurate 3D models of structures and piping systems within the respective software environments, considering geometry, material properties, loads, and boundary conditions.              Perform simulations and analyses to predict the behaviour of structures and pipelines, including deflections, stresses, and dynamic response.                      4. Code Compliance:                      Ensure that structural and piping designs comply with relevant building codes, standards, and regulations applicable to the project location and type of structure or pipeline.              Stay updated on industry codes and standards related to structural engineering and pipeline design to ensure compliance with the latest requirements.              Well verse with local and international design Codes & Standards such as IS, ASME, ASCE, UBC, etc.                      5. Interdisciplinary Coordination:                      Collaborate with designers, other engineering disciplines, project managers, and stakeholders to integrate structural and piping requirements with overall project goals and constraints.              Coordinate with civil, mechanical, and other engineers to ensure that structural and piping designs are compatible and properly integrated within the overall project.                      6. Technical Documentation:                      Prepare detailed engineering drawings, calculations, reports, and specifications documenting the structural and piping analysis and design process.              Communicate design decisions, recommendations, and results to Lead Engineer, and other project stakeholders.                      7. Quality Assurance:                      Conduct quality checks on structural and piping models, analysis results, and design outputs to ensure accuracy, consistency, and compliance with project requirements and industry standards.              Review and verify the work of other engineers or team members to ensure that designs meet quality and performance objectives.                      Supervisory Responsibility                        Supervisory responsibilities for an      Analysis Specialist      may include guiding and mentoring junior engineers, coordinating project tasks, third-party vendor management, and ensuring technical accuracy in structural & Piping analysis and design projects                           Work Environment                        The work environment for an      Analysis Specialist      typically involves office settings, though some fieldwork or site visits may be necessary for project assessments or client meetings       The work may involve collaborating with multidisciplinary teams, including civil engineers, mechanical engineers, and project managers     Additionally, they spend a significant amount of time utilizing specialized software, conducting analysis, preparing reports, and communicating with designers and Project managers                   Education, Experience, and Skills                      Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field. Advanced degrees may be preferred for senior roles.              Relevant coursework in structural analysis, mechanics, finite element analysis (FEA), piping design, fluid mechanics, and stress analysis.              Minimum 5 to 8 years of experience with structural analysis and piping flexibility analysis.              Familiarity with local and international industry standards, codes, and regulations applicable to structural engineering and piping design.              Proficiency in relevant software tools:              Proficiency in STAAD.Pro structural analysis software.              Proficiency in CAESAR II piping stress analysis software.              Strong analytical and problem-solving skills for interpreting engineering requirements and solving complex technical challenges.              Knowledge of building codes, regulations, and industry standards and piping codes and standards.              Well-versed with international codes like ASME Sec.VIII, ASME B31.3, ASCE-360, AISC-360, IBC, UBC, AS-4100, AS-1170, SP 16.13330, EN 1090, etc.

column1: Energy Transition - Process Engineer For Technip Energies
column2: About Us At Technip Energies, we believe in a better tomorrow and we believe we can make tomorrow better.? With approximately 15,000 talented women and men, we are a global and leading engineering and technology company, with a clear vision to accelerate the energy transition.? Designing and delivering added value energy solutions is what we do.? If you share our determination to drive the transition to a low-carbon future, then this could be the job for you.? About the Job: We are currently seeking? Technical Leads in low carbon technologies with a focus on the application and implementation of low carbon technologies that results in Low carbon fuels and carbon reduction  to join our team based in?Chennai, Mumbai, and Noida. This includes: Green Ammonia and Methanol. Circularity (plastic recycling). Carbon capture Biofuels (SAF, ethanol-X, marine biofuels) ?Responsibilities: Technical lead for projects/studies in any one of the above-mentioned technologies (preferred carbon capture). This will include feasibility studies, business case development, configuration, technology selection, performance estimates, cost estimating, and technical due diligence. Providing input and details on scope, execution, and schedule for Study Proposals in any one of the above-mentioned technologies. This will include leading and supporting written proposals. Provide necessary support in sales opportunities, demonstrating expertise while explaining options. Help business development team in preparing technical proposals and representations as needed. Identify technology startups, research institutes, consultants working in low carbon technologies and explore techno commercial alignment with them. Training process engineers to execute projects in above mentioned technologies. Serve as a specialist across all operating centers in India. Deliver expertise in non-standard or complex projects as lead and provide guidance to team during project execution. Handling of technical queries from clients during and after project execution. ?About You Wed love to hear from you if your profile meets the following essential requirements: Post graduate Degree in Chemical Engineering and minimum overall experience of 15 years of which at least 5 years in any of the mentioned technologies.? Familiarity with the commercial and latest Carbon Capture technologies and the comparison with each is an added advantage. Process modelling knowledge using Aspen/HYSYS, PROII. Good knowledge and interest in developing new process designs and layouts. Should be capable of driving the conceptual studies independently. Candidates with Technology licensor /OEM background is preferred but not mandatory.?
column11: Process Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Feasibility Studies, Green Ammonia, biofuels, aspen, pro ii, hysys, renewable energy, Detail Engineering, energy efficiency, energy conservation, Design Engineering, energy management, Carbon capture, energy engineering, Methanol

column2: Company: A.T.E. HUBER Envirotech Pvt. Ltd. - Water and Wastewater Treatment Company Location: Mumbai About Us: We are one of the leading engineering company specializing in water and wastewater treatment solutions. With a commitment to innovation and sustainability, we design and build customized treatment facilities that meet the unique needs of our clients while adhering to the highest industry standards. Job Description: As the Process Engineering Lead, you will play a crucial role in leading and managing process engineering activities to deliver cutting-edge water and wastewater treatment solutions. You will oversee the design, optimization, and implementation of process systems, ensuring the highest levels of efficiency, reliability, and environmental compliance. Responsibilities: 1. Team Leadership: Lead and mentor a team of engineers, providing guidance, support, and technical expertise to ensure project success. 2. Project Management: Oversee all aspects of process engineering projects, from conceptual design to commissioning, ensuring adherence to project timelines and budgets. 3. Process Design: Lead the development of process designs for water and wastewater treatment facilities, including process flow diagrams, detailed P&I Diagrams mass and energy balances, equipment specifications, data sheets and getting timely approvals from concern customer / consultant. 4. Technology Evaluation: Evaluate and recommend technologies and solutions duri bidding and providing estimation for the same 5. Regulatory Compliance: Ensure that all designs and processes comply with relevant industry standards, HAZOP regulations, and environmental requirements. 6. Client Interaction: Collaborate with clients to understand their specific requirements and objectives, and provide technical expertise and support the sales and project team. 7. Continuous Improvement: Drive continuous improvement initiatives to optimize processes, reduce costs, and enhance overall project performance. 8. Risk Management: Identify and mitigate potential risks and challenges associated with process engineering activities, ensuring project success and client satisfaction. 9. Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate closely with other departments, including design, procurement, manufacturing and construction, to ensure seamless execution and delivery. Qualifications: 1. Bachelor's degree in Chemical Engineering, Environmental Engineering, or a related field. Master's degree preferred. 2. Proven experience in process engineering, preferably in the water and wastewater treatment industry, with a minimum of 10 years of relavent experience. 3. Strong technical expertise in water and wastewater treatment processes, including biological treatment, filtration, disinfection, and sludge handling, UF, RO, DM, MBR, MEE, ATFD, MVR, 4. Proficiency in process simulation softwares fr resin and membrane manufacturers. 5. Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively lead and inspire a cross functional teams. 6. Proven track record of successfully managing complex engineering projects from conception to completion. 7. Knowledge of relevant industry standards, regulations, and best practices. 8. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and analytically. 9. Commitment to safety, quality, and sustainability principles. If you have any questions or need further clarification on any aspect of the role, please don't hesitate to reach out.  Thank you for your interest and time.

column2: SUMMARY This role is a key aspect of Ovivo professionally securing new orders, primarily for engineered water treatment packages in the Power Generation, Oil & Gas, Petrochemical, Municipal and energy industries globally.  You will be responsible for preparing budgetary and firm, technical and commercial proposals in response to specific sales enquiries, for Pure Water applications. Water treatment processes used will include, amongst others, Reverse Osmosis, Ion Exchange and Electro-deionisation along with any required pretreatment such as clarifiers, Media and Membrane filtration systems. Designs will be completed using supplier software as well as Ovivo standard spreadsheets and adapting those spreadsheets when required.  On securing new orders the role will develop the initial process design as part of the contract engineering team, liaising with other engineering disciplines so that they can complete their design aspects and the entire project can be built to time and budget constraints. During commissioning you will provide process support to the site engineers reviewing performance data and advising on any issues that arise in a timely manner. This will continue with process support to the aftersales and service team on existing and new service contracts. The role involves working effectively with other departments within Ovivo and the ability to communicate ideas to colleagues, suppliers and customers will be essential to the of this role. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  include the following: 1. Review of formal bid specifications. Working closely with Sales Managers, Proposal manager, Product Manager and the Engineering Group to execute the bid in accordance with the strategy. Assists to develop and maintain accuracy of the bid documents. 2. Develop calculations for equipment sizing, demonstrating process performance, including use of 3rd party software and Ovivo standards. 3. Preparation of budgetary proposals and development of these from a preliminary to a firm proposal working under the Proposal Manager.  4. Undertaking accurate costing of projects and associated cash flow calculations as required.  5. Production of documentation covering design aspects, scope of supply, costing etc.  6. Prepare functional design specifications and logic to communicate process requirements to software writers. 7. Provide process support to the aftersales team on refurbishment and service contracts. 8. Resolving problems by adjustments to existing equipment, addition of new equipment, or replacement by a new system, taking into account cost effectiveness, customer preferences and the correct technical approach. 9. Updates to completed proposals to keep track of project status, purchase dates, etc. Re-quoting as needed. 10. Provide hand-over packages to Operations for awarded Projects. 11. Evaluate design safety factors and process risk 12. Participation in review meetings when called upon including HAZOP and access, lifting and maintenance reviews. 13. Performing all work in accordance with established safety procedures 14. Work with other disciplines to evaluate impact of changes to design and document these impacts according to Ovivo procedures 15. Provide technical input to Operation and maintenance manuals 16. Prepare training documents for customer training. 17. Assist commissioning engineers with commissioning and optimizing of pure water treatment plants 18. Other duties may be assigned as required. EDUCATION, TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE BEng or BSc Degree (or equivalent) gained in an Engineering discipline (Mechanical or Chemical) along with a minimum of 5 years of experience with pure water processes in the Energy Markets.   INDEPENDENT JUDGEMENT, DECISION MAKING & PROBLEM SOLVING: Ability to apply principles of logic and scientific thinking and decision making requiring the use of a variety of variables in standard situations.  Ability to bring a clear understanding of this role impacts the sales cycle.   OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES Computer skills:   Must have computer experience using company standard software and Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Graphic application programs. Experience of working in AutoCAD and Inventor. Mathematical skills:  Ability to understand and apply mathematical concepts  Knowledge of basic engineering calculations is required along with an understanding of specific product related functions, such as time study calculations.
